result.execSummary:
The defendant Stacey P Elmer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

miscConds.notes:
$1,707.00 BAIL APPLIED. Remaining balance of fine to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
BAIL APPLIED. Blood draw costs PAID IN FULL. To be forwarded to the City of Waukesha Police Dept.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drugs screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.
Provide DNA sample if not already provided.
Case 14TR261 was dismissed and read into: 14CF82.

timeConds.notes:
Condition Time - nonworking conditions. With Standard release conditions.
FORTHWITH. Court will allow the Defendant to be released for extended hours 5 days a week to allow transportation to and from work.

Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Stacey P Elmer in court with attorney Anna M Kees.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Case 14TR261 dismissed and read in to this matter.

Court orders the following: 
- Total sentence: 6 years (Initial Confinement: 3 years, Extended Supervision: 3 years) STAYED 
- 3 years Probation
- 36 months Drivers License Revocation. 
- 36 months Ignition Interlock on any vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to defendant 
- Alcohol Assessment
- Attendance at the Victim Impact Panel meeting already completed.
- Fine of $1,973.00; cash bail to be applied to costs and fines; any remaining costs and fines to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Blood Test Reimbursement of $35.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to Waukesha Police Department
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00; cash bail to be applied to costs and fines; any remaining costs and fines to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Transcript fees of $8.00; cash bail to be applied to costs and fines; any remaining costs and fines to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Conditions of Probation:  Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.  DNA Sample if not yet provided, defendant to pay surcharge.
CONDITION TIME: 9 MONTHS - NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - To commence FORTHWITH.  Defendant remanded to the custody of the Sheriff to commence the Condition Time.  Court will allow defendant to be released for extended hours 5 days of the week to allow for transportation to and from work.
Three Character letters filed.
Letter from Treatment Provider.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 11, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 30, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 28, 2014 at 09:00 am.

  Hearing scheduled for March 10, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Filed by Attorney Kees
Hearing on February 10, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program.  He shall report first business day following release. Defendant ordered to SCRAM monitoring.  Defendant to pay costs associated with SCRAM monitoring.  Defendants who can not  pay will be required to follow an enhanced level of direct supervision requirements as established by WCS.  WCS will notify the Court.   Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.   Defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Defendant is allowed non phone call.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Defendant Stacey P Elmer in court, in custody, with attorney Joan Broughton.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for February 10, 2014 at 10:00 am.
